subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “wether”
: {{der|zh|sit}}; cognate with {{och-l|羖|(black) [[ram]]}}, as well as {{cog|kfk|tr=kʰas}}, {{cog|cik|tr=kʰa}}, {{m|cik|tr=kʰɘs|t=sheep}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
: Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Wang (1982)}} relates this word to {{och-l|割|to cut}}.

; “Jie people”
: Possibly of {{bor|zh|qfa-yen}} origin. {{zh-ref|Pulleyblank (1962)}} connects the ethnonym to {{cog|qfa-yen-pro|*qeˀt ~ *qeˀs||stone}}. {{zh-ref|Vovin et al. (2016)}} additionally proposes {{m|qfa-yen-pro|*keˀt||person, human being}} as a possible etymon. This character was likely chosen to transcribe the indigenous name of the tribe for its pejorative meaning ([[ibid.]]).
